courses.name: Teaching the Exceptional Learner
courses.description: Teaching the Exceptional Learner addresses topics in the foundations of pedagogy for students with disabilities in inclusive settings, including the roles and responsibilities of the general educator and related service personnel with respect to special education law and policy, behavior management, universal design for learning, and evidence-based practices.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to Special Education
courses.description: Introductory overview of the field of special education; historical developments, characteristics of special populations, and compliance with state and federal regulations.

courses.name: Behavioral Management for Exceptional Students
courses.description: Study of classroom management and applied behavior analysis strategies. Focus on teacher as decision-maker in the design, implementation, evaluation of individual and group management programs.

courses.name: Assessment and Evaluation in Special Education
courses.description: Procedures and instruments used in the assessment of individual with disabilities, including standardized and non-standardized measures of intellectual ability, academic achievement, oral language, social/emotional behaviors, career/vocational needs.

courses.name: Language Development of Exceptional Students
courses.description: Study of language and communication issues and disorders in special education; normal and atypical language development; language assessment and intervention models and programs.

courses.name: Collaboration and Consultation in Special Education
courses.description: Study of communication, problem-solving, collaboration strategies. Application of strategies to work with exceptional students, their families, other professional members of interdisciplinary, interagency teams.

courses.name: Literacy in Special Education
courses.description: Addresses specific literacy needs of students who are at-risk or have special needs with a focus on assessment and instruction in general education classrooms.

courses.name: Literacy in Special Education II
courses.description: Advanced study in literacy methods and research for students with disabilities.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Cross Categorical Special Education
courses.description: Study of characteristics of students with cross categorical disabilities and other pertinent issues including inclusion, assessment, and evaluation practices.

courses.name: Methods in Cross-Categorical Special Education
courses.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7380). This course is designed to provide students with research-based instructional and behavior management methods for use with student with cross-categorical disabilities.

courses.name: Methods in Cross-Categorical Special Education - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7380). This course is designed to provide students with research-based instructional and behavior management methods for use with student with cross-categorical disabilities.

courses.name: Methods in Vocational Education for the Disabled and Disadvantaged
courses.description: (same as LTC_V 4770). Study of legislation, interagency cooperation, curriculum, transition, evaluation/grading role of support personnel. For educators, counselors and administrators working in vocational settings with special needs students and students with disabilities.

courses.name: Topics in Special Education
courses.description: In-depth study of certain developments, findings, trends and issues in one or more areas of special education.

courses.name: Cross-Categorical Special Education: Practicum I
courses.description: Involvement in meaningful field-based activities that extend and/or apply content information from SPC_ED 4375.
courses.hours: 1-4Prerequisites or Corequisites: SPC_ED 4375Recommended: Admittance to Phase II

courses.name: Practicum in Cross-Categorical II
courses.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7941). The purpose of this course is to provide students with experience in applying the content of Special Education 4380 (i.e. assessment and intervention strategies for use with students with cross categorical disabilities). This course may be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Capstone Seminar and Portfolio in Special Education
courses.description: Students in final student teaching internship will meet weekly to examine and compare their internship experiences.  Analysis, synthesis, evaluation and problem solving are the focus of the examination of various aspects of pedagogy and experience.  Additionally, students will develop and submit for scoring their State mandated certification portfolio.
courses.recommendation: Enrollment in final semester of student teaching internship

courses.name: Internship in Special Education
courses.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7981).  This field experience provides preservice interns a semester-long public school experience where they simultaneously engage in a unique combination of observation and teaching.  Through observation, conferencing, reading, discussion, demonstration, and participation, the preservice intern will synthesize the course concepts of the Senior Year On-Site Program (SYOSP).  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Teaching the Exceptional Learner
courses.description: Teaching the Exceptional Learner addresses topics in the foundations of pedagogy for students with disabilities in inclusive settings, including the roles and responsibilities of the general educator and related service personnel with respect to special education law and policy, behavior management, universal design for learning, and evidence-based practices.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to Special Education
courses.description: Introductory overview of the field of special education; historical developments, characteristics of special populations, and compliance with state and federal regulations.

courses.name: Behavioral Management for Exceptional Students
courses.description: Study of classroom management and applied behavior analysis strategies. Focus on teacher as decision-maker in the design, implementation, evaluation of individual and group management programs.

courses.name: Assessment and Evaluation in Special Education
courses.description: Procedures and instruments used in the assessment of individual with disabilities, including standardized and non-standardized measures of intellectual ability, academic achievement, oral language, social/emotional behaviors, career/vocational needs.

courses.name: Language Development of Exceptional Students
courses.description: Study of language and communication issues and disorders in special education; normal and atypical language development; language assessment and intervention models and programs.

courses.name: Collaboration and Consultation in Special Education
courses.description: Study of communication, problem-solving, collaboration strategies. Application of strategies to work with exceptional students, their families, other professional members of interdisciplinary, interagency teams.

courses.name: Literacy in Special Education
courses.description: Addresses specific literacy needs of students who are at-risk or have special needs with a focus on assessment and instruction in general education classrooms.

courses.name: Literacy in Special Education II
courses.description: Advanced study in literacy methods and research for students with disabilities.  Graded A-F only.

courses.name: Cross Categorical Special Education
courses.description: Study of characteristics of students with cross categorical disabilities and other pertinent issues including inclusion, assessment, and evaluation practices.

courses.name: Methods in Cross-Categorical Special Education
courses.description: This course is designed to provide students with research-based instructional and behavior management methods for use with student with cross-categorical disabilities.
courses.prerequisites: professional standing in Phase II, SPC_ED 4375, SPC_ED 4940

courses.name: Methods in Vocational Education for the Disabled & Disadvantaged
courses.description: (same as LTC_V 7770). Study of legislation, interagency cooperation, curriculum, transition, evaluation/grading role of support personnel. For educators, counselors and administrators working in vocational settings with special needs students and students with disabilities.

courses.name: Topics in Special Education
courses.description: In-depth study of certain developments, findings, trends and issues in one or more areas of special education.

courses.name: Cross-Categorical Special Education: Practicum I
courses.description: Involvement in meaningful field-based activities that extend and/or apply content information from Special Education 4375.
courses.hours: 3Prerequisites or Corequisites: SPC_ED 4375, professional standing in Phase II

courses.name: Practicum in Cross-Categorical II
courses.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4941). The purpose of this course is to provide students with experience in applying the content of Special Education 4380 (i.e. assessment and intervention strategies for use with students with cross categorical disabilities). This course may be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Internship in Special Education
courses.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4981). This field experience provides preservice interns a semester-long public school experience where they simultaneously engage in a unique combination of observation and teaching. Through observation, conferencing, reading, discussion, demonstration, and participation, the preservice intern will synthesize the course concepts of the Senior Year On-Site Program (SYOSP). Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: ED_LPA 7060; Admittance to the College of Education

courses.name: Masters Thesis Research Hours
courses.description: Restricted to students enrolled in the graduate program.  Graded S/U only.

courses.name: Using Assessment to Guide Instruction
courses.description: This course is designed to present information on the evaluation of individual student skills and the effects of instruction on those skills.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: School-Wide Positive Behavior Support
courses.description: Overview of theory, research, and methods related to establishing a system of positive behavior support in schools.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Professional Seminar in Special Education
courses.description: Designed to provide overview of Special Education, COE program requirements, and general graduate student expectations. Students STRONGLY encouraged to take course first semester in graduate program. Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: acceptance into a master's degree program

courses.name: Students with Behavioral Disorders
courses.description: Study of characteristics of students with behavioral disorders as they relate to best practices for assessment, instruction, and intervention.

courses.name: Students With Learning Disabilities
courses.description: Study of characteristics of students with learning disabilities as they relate to best practices for assessment, instruction, and intervention.

courses.name: Advanced Studies in Developmental Disabilities
courses.description: Current theories and practices and their historic roots through examination of empirical and descriptive literature.
courses.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent

courses.name: Trends and Issues in Special Education
courses.description: A study of the historical developments and related trends, issues and problems associated with the education of exceptional students.
courses.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent

courses.name: Research with Exceptional Children
courses.description: Explores significant, historical, and current research in special education. Emphasizes the application of research, methodology, and findings relative to problems facing the practitioner.

courses.name: Advanced Studies: Single Subject Design
courses.description: The course is for advanced graduate students in special education, k psychology, related fields and includes behavioral measurement, single subject research designs, data analysis methods, critical analysis and evaluation of single subject research and research proposal. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Grant Writing
courses.description: Preparation of research, demonstration, training, or other grant proposals meeting the criteria for competitive funding by a federal agency; review and evaluation of proposals.
courses.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent

courses.name: Special Education Administration
courses.description: Principles, protective safeguards, and general practices associated with the organization and administration of special education; legal foundations for special education; selection, training, and supervision of personnel.

courses.name: Research Design in Special Education
courses.description: Overview of professional writing and intermediate research applications with a focus on knowledge and skills needed for higher level doctoral work in statistics and research design.
courses.prerequisites: ESC_PS 4170 or equivalent, SPC_ED 8350 or equivalent, and instructor's consent

courses.name: Foundations I: History, Law and Policy in Special Education
courses.description: The changing concept of disability will be viewed from the perspectives of history, legal issues, and policy traced from early Greek and European periods through contemporary times.

courses.name: Foundations II: Pedagogical Theories in Special Education
courses.description: A study of theories of teaching as they apply to special education with emphases on empirically based practices, historical trends, current theories, and the relationship between theories of learning and teaching.

courses.name: Nature and Needs of Gifted and Talented Students
courses.description: A conceptual and empirical examination for educational personnel of student identification procedures, special populations, programming issues, research topics and teacher competencies.

courses.name: Curriculum Methods for Gifted and Talented Students
courses.description: A theoretical examination for educational personnel of specific instructional approaches including structure of intellect, enrichment triad, empirical research, and creative problem solving.

courses.name: Affective Development of Gifted Students
courses.description: Psychosocial development of gifted students; theories, and practices in affective development; strategies to develop positive self-concept, successful coping strategies, and effective peer relationships by gifted students.

courses.name: Assessment and Evaluation in Gifted Education
courses.description: Seminar focuses on practices for identifying students for gifted education programs, evaluation models applicable to school programs and strategies for grading and evaluation of gifted students.

courses.name: Differentiating Instruction: Reaching Gifted, Typical and Struggling Learners
courses.description: Explores various instructional approaches to help meet the learning needs of a range of learners from gifted through struggling and at-risk students. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Introduction to Special Education; instructor's consent

courses.name: Advanced Behavior Management: Applied Behavior Analysis
courses.description: This course will provide graduate students with advanced theory and knowledge in behavior management. Emphasis will be placed on understanding and using the principles of applied behavior analysis.

courses.name: Advanced Studies in Behavioral Disorders
courses.description: Contemporary issues a historical perspective; theoretical perspectives or models which guide research, policy, and intervention approaches.
courses.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent

courses.name: Advanced Literacy in Special Education
courses.description: Study of literacy assessment and instruction methods specific to special education; formal and informal assessment: language and instructional strategies to improve literacy for students with disabilities.

courses.name: Advanced Studies in Learning Disabilities
courses.description: Major current issues, trends, and controversies in learning disabilities; theories, research, and practices in learning disabilities.
courses.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent

courses.name: Introduction and Methods of Early Intervention
courses.description: This course will enhance individual knowledge and skills necessary to design, implement, and evaluate research-based strategies and practices in home and center-based programs for infants and toddlers with disabilities, consistent with the philosophical and legal requirements of IDEA Part C.

courses.name: Assessment in Early Childhood Special Education
courses.description: Procedures and instruments used in assessment of children with special needs, including screening, diagnosis, interpretation of diagnostic findings, and application to instructional plans.

courses.name: Introduction and Methods of Early Childhood Special Education
courses.description: This course will enhance individual knowledge and skills necessary to design, implement, and evaluate research-based strategies and practices in community or public school integrated programs for preschools with disabilities, consistent with the philosophical and legal requirements of IDEA Part B Section 619.

courses.name: Advanced Studies in Early Childhood Special Education
courses.description: Origins, theoretical perspectives, issues, scope and efficacy of the field of early childhood special education.

courses.name: Meeting the Needs of all Learners
courses.description: The purpose of this course is to provide information on current research and methodology on teaching students who are struggling or who have disabilities. Open only to teaching fellows.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Introduction to Autism
courses.description: This course provides an introduction of children youth with autism spectrum disorders. Topics include: historical and theoretical foundations, diagnostic and assessment approaches, and characteristics. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Introduction to Special Education; instructor's consent

courses.name: Methods of Instruction for Students with Autism
courses.description: Overview of interventions for individuals with autism spectrum disorders and strategies needed for teaching. Best practices and promising practices will be presented. Course graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Social Competency for Students with Autism
courses.description: Course provides a framework for addressing social competence deficits experienced by students with autism. Course graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: High Functioning Students with Autism
courses.description: The course is designed to increase understanding and ability to support individuals on the Autism Spectrum who have average to above average intelligence. Course graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Young Children with Autism
courses.description: Current research on characteristics, diagnosis, and intervention for very young children with autism. Strategies for support children and their families. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Assessment in Autism, Special Education
courses.description: This course covers procedures and instruments used in assessment of school-aged children with autism, including screening, diagnosis, interpretation of assessment findings, and application to instructional plans. Graded on A-F only.

courses.name: Practicum: Students with Behavioral Disorders
courses.description: Graduate field experience in educational setting for students with behavioral disorders. Application of competencies from Special Education  8300.

courses.name: Practicum: Students with Learning Disabilities
courses.description: Graduate field experience in educational setting for students with learning disabilities. Application of competencies from SPC_ED 8310.

courses.name: Practicum: Students with Developmental Disabilities
courses.description: Graduate field experience in educational setting for students with mental retardation. Application of knowledge and skills from SPC_ED 8320.

courses.name: Practicum in Special Education
courses.description: Provides graduate practicum experience relevant to the education of exceptional students.

courses.name: Practicum I: Cross-Categorical Special Education
courses.description: Graduate field-based experience focused on observation and participation in programming for students with mild-moderate disabilities.

courses.name: Practicum II: Cross-Categorical Special Education
courses.description: Advanced graduate field experience. Demonstration of required competencies with mild-moderate disabilities.
courses.prerequisites: SPC_ED 8944 and instructor and/or advisor's consent

courses.name: Practicum: Gifted Education
courses.description: Provides graduate field experience in the area of gifted education.

courses.name: Practicum: Early Childhood Special Education
courses.description: Graduate field experience in an approved setting for young children with special needs. May be repeated.

courses.name: Research in Special Education
courses.description: Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Professional Seminar in Special Education
courses.description: Designed to provide overview of Special Education, COE program requirements, and general graduate student expectations. Students STRONGLY encouraged to take course first semester in graduate program. Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: acceptance into a master's degree program

courses.name: Internship: College Teaching in Special Education
courses.description: Individually guided and supervised college teaching experiences. Competency based activities using portfolio assessment methods. May be taken more than once. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Internship: Special Education Research
courses.description: Individually guided research internship with doctoral advisor and/or faculty mentor(s). Opportunity to develop research competencies either on individual or collaborative projects. May be taken more than once. Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Internship: Professional Practice in Special Education
courses.description: Individually guided internship in the public schools and/or agencies serving students with special needs or exceptionalities. Focus on professional practices, administrative practices, and/or evaluation practices. Graded on S/U basis only.
